body.p: I have received information that Tennessee troops are under the orders to occupy Island Number one, six miles below Cairo. In accordance with my understanding with Genl. Buckner, I call upon you to prevent this step. Do you regard the Islands on the Mississippi river above the Tennessee line as within your jurisdiction, and if so, what ones?

Respectfully
G. B. McClellan
Adj. Genl. U. S. A.

Frankfort, Ky. June 11, 1861.
Gen. G. B. McClellan, Cincinnati, Ohio

Gen Buckner has gone to Paducah and Columbus -- has orders to carry out his understanding with you -- am investigating the question of jurisdiction over the Islands to which you allude -- will answer further, probably tomorrow

Frankfort, June 11, 1861
Gen. S. B. Buckner, Paducah and Columbus Ky

Gen. McClellan telegraphs me he has reliable information Tennessee troops are under orders for Island No. One, six miles below Cairo, and calls upon me to prevent it according to his understanding with you. It may be we have no jurisdiction over the Islands to which he alludes. I am investigating the question, and have telegraphed him you have orders to carry out understanding -- will telegraph you again tomorrow. The other matter has my approval.

Frankfort, Ky. June 12, 1861.
Gen. G. B. McClellan, Cincinnati, Ohio.
The jurisdiction of Kentucky extends over Wolfe Island, Islands nos. one and eight, and all Islands in the Mississippi river to the Tennessee line similarly situated
Copy of despatches between Genl McClellan & myself --
